entryPoints.title: Entry Points
entryPoints.description: The list of entry points to which the router is attached. If not specified, TCP routers are attached to all TCP entry points.

rule.title: Rule
rule.description: Rules are a set of matchers configured with values, that determine if a particular connection matches specific criteria. If the rule is verified, the router becomes active, calls middlewares, and then forwards the connection to the service.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: To avoid rule overlap, routes are sorted, by default, in descending order using rules length. The priority is directly equal to the length of the rule, and so the longest length has the highest priority. A value of 0 for the priority is ignored.

middlewares.title: Middlewares
middlewares.description: The list of middlewares that are applied to the router. Middlewares are applied in the order they are declared.

service.title: Service
service.description: The name of the service that will handle the matched connections. Services can be load balancer services or weighted round robin services.

tls.title: TLS

passthrough.title: Passthrough
passthrough.description: When true, TLS connections are passed through to the backend service without termination at Traefik

certResolver.title: Certificate Resolver
certResolver.description: Specifies which certificate resolver to use for obtaining TLS certificates (e.g., letsencrypt)

options.title: Options
options.description: References a named TLS options configuration that defines cipher suites, protocols, and other security settings

domains.title: Domains

main.title: Main Domain
main.description: The primary domain name for the certificate

sans.title: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: Additional Subject Alternative Names (subdomains) for the certificate

domains.description: Array of domain objects for certificate generation

tls.description: TLS configuration for the router. When specified, the router will only handle TLS connections.
